description: Conversion of second and third floor dwelling into four self-contained flats (2 x 2b4p, 1 x 2b3p, 1 x 1b2p). Third floor mansard extension and construction of a three storey rear extension with associated internal alterations, and refuse and cycle storage.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following Drawings received by Council:
- PL-06 - Block Plan
- EX-01 - Existing Basement and Ground Floor General Arrangement Plans
- EX-02 - Existing First and Second Floor General Arrangement Plans
- EX-03 - Existing Roof Level Plan
- EX-04 - Existing Elevations
- PL-01 - Proposed Ground and First Floor General Arrangement Plans
- PL-02 - Proposed Second and Third Floor General Arrangement Plans
- PL-03 - Proposed Roof Level Plan
- PL-04 - Proposed Elevations

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development (including the balustrades) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these materials which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures for providing fresh air ventilation to the residential units facing the Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to the first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of Ealing Council's Development Management Policies DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a noise assessment, by an approved acoustic consultant shall be carried out in accordance with the criteria specified in the Supplementary Planning Guide for Noise and Vibration (SPG10). The assessment along with a scheme of proposed noise mitigation measures, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants who will be living in proximity to Broadway, in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing Council's Development Management Policies DPD (adopted 2013) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016). | Sheltered and secure parking for at least 7 cycles shall be made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that the approved provision cycle parking is available in the interest of the highways management and the aims of promoting sustainable transport, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016 as amended), Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD, and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | The refuse storage facilities shown on the approved plans shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure suitable refuse storage and collection facilities are provided prior to occupation in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Policies 5.16 and 5.17 of the London Plan. | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until a Demolition and Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The management plan must refer to the following matters (as applicable):
a) Removal of any earth from the site.
b) Construction methods.
c) Site management and access.
d) Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site;
e) Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on The Broadway and A4020;
f) Vehicle and machinery specification.
g) Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h) Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i) Parking of construction vehicles.
j) Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k) Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l) Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m) Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason: To protect the amenity of neighbouring properties and mitigate impacts to highway traffic in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
